snippet: Kim Kyong-hui was named on a leadership list in North Korea’s state-run media, signaling she may have avoided the fate of her husband, who was executed last week.
abstract: Kim Kyong-hui, aunt of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, is included in roster of top officials appointed to committee in charge of organizing state funeral for former party secretary Kim Kuk-tae; inclusion on list, considered indicator of governmental favor, suggests that she has politically survived purge and execution of her husband Jang Song-thaek.

byline.contributor: Brian Knowlton contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Kim Kyong-hui was named on a leadership list in North Korea’s state-run media, signaling she may have avoided the fate of her husband, who was executed last week.

headline.main: North Korean Leader’s Aunt Appears Unscathed
headline.print_headline: North Korean Leader’s Aunt Appears Unscathed
